definition: Manchurian Qing (refers to the Qing dynasty, esp. at its decline, or as an anti-Qing slogan)
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: He supposed one of them announced the visit of the Manchu.
sentences.chinese: 他估量其中有一张是通知那位满清大员莅临的消息。

sentences.english: Jack took up a coco-nut shell that brimmed with fresh water and drank.
sentences.chinese: 杰克拿起一只盛满清水的椰壳一饮而尽。

sentences.english: At the modern times, the Ching dynasty was decadent and declining.
sentences.chinese: 时至近代，满清王朝腐朽没落。

sentences.english: The Phoenix Pavilion was the place where emperor and his empress and concubines informal dined and read.
sentences.chinese: 凤凰楼是满清皇帝和后妃便宴及读书之处。

definition: the Qing court (as government of China)
the (great) Ch'ing or Qing dynasty (1644-1911)/Qing Empire
Eight Banners, military organization of Manchu later Jin dynasty 後金|后金[Hou4 Jin1] from c. 1600, subsequently of the Qing dynasty
Wu Sangui (1612-1678), Chinese general who let the Manchus into China and helped them establish the Qing Dynasty, later leading a revolt against Qing in an effort to start his own dynasty
Later Jin dynasty (from 1616-)/Manchu Khanate or kingdom that took over as Qing dynasty in 1644
Manchou township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
Nurhaci (1559-1626), founder and first Khan of the Manchu Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金 (from 1616)
Tsarist Russia/abbr. for 沙皇俄國|沙皇俄国[Sha1 huang2 E2 guo2]
